name: Inertial Navigator
description: A small (10cm x 6 cm x 1 cm) inertial navigation computer which allows the user to backtrack on his path by â€œremembering movements and turns. Switched on at the point from which the user sets out, it will allow him to find his way back later from any distance. A simple math function can also allow the user to determine a straight line distance and direction to his starting point no matter where he is.

sources.publication: Traveller 5.10 Core Rules Book 3 : Worlds and Adventures
